info.name: petstore.swagger
info.description: > **Swagger Petstore is a sample API designed to demonstrate how Swagger/OpenAPI works.** It simulates a fictional online pet store where you can manage pets, users, and store orders. Developers use it as a sandbox to learn, test, and showcase API documentation and tooling.

item.name: 01 Pet
01.1 add new pet to the store

exec: pm.test("F01 Req01 TC01 - Validate response status code is 200", () => {
pm.test("F01 Req01 TC02 - Validate response time is under 1000ms", () => {
pm.test("F01 Req01 TC03 - Validate Content-Type header is application/json", () => {
pm.test("F01 Req01 TC04 - Validate Server header exists", () => {
// pm.test("F01 Req01 TC05 - Validate Content-Length header is greater than 0", () => {
pm.test("F01 Req01 TC06 - Validate create pet response matches expected schema", () => {
pm.test("F01 Req01 TC07 - Validate response contains same values as request body", () => {
pm.test("F01 Req01 TC08 - Validate pet name matches collection variable", () => {
pm.test("F01 Req01 TC09 - Validate category name matches collection variable", () => {
pm.test("F01 Req01 TC10 - Validate status matches collection variable", () => {
pm.test("F01 Req01 TC11 - Validate status is available, pending, or sold", () => {

request.description:
Generated from cURL: curl -X 'POST' \
  'https://petstore.swagger.io/v2/pet/1244/uploadImage' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Content-Type: multipart/form-data' \
  -F 'additionalMetadata=dsq' \
  -F 'file=@api-testing.avif;type=image/avif'

Problem accessing /v2/pet/6713/uploadImage. Reason:

item.description: > **The “Pet” module in Swagger Petstore is the part of the demo API that handles everything related to pets.** It lets you add, update, search, and delete pets in the store, and is often used to practice CRUD operations in API testing.

item.name: 02 Store

exec: pm.test("F02 Req01 TC01 - Validate response status code is 200", () => {
pm.test("F02 Req01 TC02 - Validate response time is under 1000ms", () => {
pm.test("F02 Req01 TC03 - Validate Content-Type header is application/json", () => {
pm.test("F02 Req01 TC04 - Validate Server header exists", () => {
pm.test("F02 Req01 TC05 - Validate inventory response schema", () => {
pm.test("F02 Req01 TC06 - Validate response contains required status keys", () => {
pm.test("F02 Req01 TC07 - Validate all inventory values are non-negative integers", () => {
pm.test("F02 Req01 TC08 - Validate 'available' count is greater than or equal to 0", () => {
pm.test("F02 Req01 TC09 - Validate 'pending' count is greater than or equal to 0", () => {
pm.test("F02 Req01 TC10 - Validate 'sold' count is greater than or equal to 0", () => {
pm.test("F02 Req01 TC11 - Validate response contains at least expected status keys", () => {

item.name: 02.2 Place an order for a pet

exec: // Random past date generator (ISO format, any year before today)
const start = new Date(startYear, 0, 1).getTime(); // Jan 1 of startYear
const end = new Date().getTime();                  // current day
const shipDate = randomPastDate(1990);               // random date between 1990 and today
const complete = Math.random() < 0.5;                // true or false
// Set variables in Postman (reusing pet variables from previous script)
id: pm.collectionVariables.get("orderId"),        // now using random orderId
pm.test("F02 Req02 TC01 - Validate response status code is 200", () => {

pm.test("F02 Req02 TC04 - Validate order response schema", () => {

pm.test("F02 Req02 TC06 - Validate quantity is at least 1", () => {
pm.test("F02 Req02 TC07 - Validate shipDate is before today", () => {
pm.test("F02 Req02 TC08 - Validate status is available, pending, or sold", () => {
pm.test("F02 Req02 TC09 - Validate complete is boolean", () => {

request.description:
Generated from cURL: curl -X 'POST' \
  'https://petstore.swagger.io/v2/store/order' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
  "id": 1,
  "petId": 2,
  "quantity": 4,
  "shipDate": "2025-11-18T04:45:21.420Z",
  "status": "placed",
  "complete": true
}'

item.description: > The **Store resource** in Swagger Petstore manages orders and inventory. It demonstrates how APIs handle transactional data and simple business logic. This module is often used to practice testing order flows, error handling, and stock tracking.

    "id": 1,
    "username": "string",
    "firstName": "string",
    "lastName": "string",
    "email": "string",

    "phone": "string",
    "userStatus": 0

]'

item.description: > The User resource in Swagger Petstore manages accounts and authentication. It demonstrates how APIs handle user data, login sessions, and lifecycle operations. This module is often used to practice testing identity flows and CRUD operations.
